str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From meta and noieo; to think differently or afterwards, i.e. Reconsider.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Lit: I dip, submerge, but specifically of ceremonial dipping; I baptize.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A sending away, a letting go, a release, pardon, complete forgiveness. From aphiemi; freedom; pardon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From hamartano; a sin.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A (free) gift, a gift (without repayment). From doron; a gratuity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.
